Here, you can apply your talent in bold ways that matter.Job Description:Job Title: CS eOrdering Support Specialist (m/f/*) (New Health Care Company)3M is establishing two industry-leading companies, creating value through the spin-off of its Health Care business, while 3M will continue to be a global material science leader, focusing our innovation to win in favorable global megatrends and attractive end markets. This new Health Care Company will be a leading global diversified health technology company with:     Proven category leadership  
Exposure to attractive end-markets  
Innovation mindset driving improved patient outcomes  
Collaborative customer relationships  
Deep global regulatory experience  
Operational excellence and strong cash flow  
Strong sales growth and profitability with significant recurring sales  We expect the creation of the two companies will be completed by the end of 2023. For now, we will continue to operate as one global company. This role is positioned to drive the success of the "New Health Care Company”.  This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military experience to a 3M career.The Impact You’ll Make in this Role
 As a CS eOrdering Support Specialist*, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:customer facing aspects of eOrdering support, including bCom & ePOP (ePOP – no technical expertise needed, but coordination between GSC and local team),
maintenance & support of EDI market places/portals/providers,
participate in/run clean-up projects : old orders, old blocks, old SFDC cases, old returns,
supporting customers with coordination and implementation of EDI connections as well as supporting project/issues with OCR tools used within ordering process
may be responsible for more technical tasks related EDI connection: including requirements definition, data integrity, testing, training and reporting as well as monitoring of daily EDI operations (verification of EDI transmissions, compliance assurance, troubleshooting and performance of root cause analysis, data exception handling, and re-processing when necessary.Your Skills and Expertise To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:Experience in Order management as user, super user, support function, integrating electronic flow management (Electronic Data Interchange, Optical Characters Recognition, web platforms…)
SAP experience (including other stream than OTC such as LEX-Logistic Execution)
Bachelor’s Degree with an accredited University / College
Advanced EnglishAdditional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:Experience working with different EDI standards and formats, iDoc reprocessing
System mapping experience
Capability to manage multiple projects in parallel, including technical/supply chain dimensionsFor current employees, internal transfer restrictions may not apply. For more details, contact your local recruiter/HR team.Work location:Work Your Way Eligible (Employee choice to work remote, on site, or hybrid)Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).Supporting Your Well-being 3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.
